class.name: OpenXRInterface
class.description: The OpenXR interface allows Godot to interact with OpenXR runtimes and make it possible to create XR experiences and games. Due to the needs of OpenXR this interface works slightly different than other plugin based XR interfaces. It needs to be initialized when Godot starts. You need to enable OpenXR, settings for this can be found in your games project settings under the XR heading. You do need to mark a viewport for use with XR in order for Godot to know which render result should be output to the headset.

method.name: get_action_sets
method.description: Returns a list of action sets registered with Godot (loaded from the action map at runtime).

method.name: get_available_display_refresh_rates
method.description: Returns display refresh rates supported by the current HMD. Only returned if this feature is supported by the OpenXR runtime and after the interface has been initialized.

method.name: is_action_set_active
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given action set is active.

method.name: set_action_set_active
method.description: Sets the given action set as active or inactive.

members.member: The display refresh rate for the current HMD. Only functional if this feature is supported by the OpenXR runtime and after the interface has been initialized.
The render size multiplier for the current HMD. Must be set before the interface has been initialized.

signal.name: pose_recentered
signal.description: Informs the user queued a recenter of the player position.

signal.name: session_begun
signal.description: Informs our OpenXR session has been started.

signal.name: session_focussed
signal.description: Informs our OpenXR session now has focus.

signal.name: session_stopping
signal.description: Informs our OpenXR session is stopping.

signal.name: session_visible
signal.description: Informs our OpenXR session is now visible (output is being sent to the HMD).
